definitions.definition: To find an answer or solution to a problem or question; to work out .
to find out the perpetrator, the motive etc ( of crime )
examples: to solve a murder to solve a crime

definitions.definition: To find the values of variables that satisfy a system of equations and/or inequalities .

To algebraically manipulate an equation or inequality into a form that isolates a chosen variable on one side, so that the other side consists of an expression that may be used to generate solutions .
To loosen or separate the parts of.

main_definition: To find an answer or solution to a problem or question; to work out .
secondary_definitions: to find out the perpetrator, the motive etc ( of crime )
( mathematics ) To find the values of variables that satisfy a system of equations and/or inequalities .

( mathematics ) To algebraically manipulate an equation or inequality into a form that isolates a chosen variable on one side, so that the other side consists of an expression that may be used to generate solutions .
( transitive ) To loosen or separate the parts of.
